thread.title: Live in Mayor Bill de Blasio's Park Slope Property for $1,825 a Month
thread.title_full: Live in Mayor Bill de Blasio's Park Slope Property for $1,825 a Month

title: Live in Mayor Bill de Blasio's Park Slope Property for $1,825 a Month
text:
Live in Mayor Bill de Blasio's Park Slope Property for $1,825 a Month By Leslie Albrecht | March 20, 2017 11:17am DNAinfo/James Fanelli; (inset) DNAinfo/Katie Honan 
Mayor Bill de Blasio is bringing affordable housing to Park Slope, one apartment at a time. 
The mayor is renting out a one-bedroom apartment in one of his Park Slope properties for just $1,825 a month. That's a relative steal in the neighborhood, where one-bedrooms rented for an average of $2,542 a month in February, according to the real estate firm MNS . 
A StreetEasy listing describes the available rental, first reported by Politico , as a "sunny and sweet" apartment in "prime South Slope." The one-bedroom is located in a modest wood-frame row house on 11th Street between Fifth and Sixth avenues. 
The row house is one of two buildings de Blasio owns on 11th Street . The mayor's other property, on 11th Street between Sixth and Seventh avenues, was his primary residence before he moved to Gracie Mansion .
